title: Belton House Walks

images.title: Mark Holland, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Belton House

images.title: David Dixon / The Boathouse, Belton Gardens
images.caption: Lakeside Boathouse

images.title: K  A / Formal Garden - Belton House
images.caption: Formal Garden. This area of Belton's gardens is situated directly behind the house and its formal layout is designed to be seen at its best by the elevated view from the house itself.

images.title: K  A / Courtyard - Belton House
images.caption: Courtyard. The eastern side of the courtyard is formed by this building with its grand clock tower. The clock face overlooks the stable yard behind the building. Beneath the clock tower is the passage leading to the stable yard.

images.title: K  A / St. Peter and St. Paul Church - Belton
images.caption: St. Peter and St. Paul Church. The house's fine gardens make a splendid foreground to this view of Belton's parish church.

images.title: David Dixon / Summerhouse Overlooking Mirror Pond
images.caption: Garden temple. Summerhouse Overlooking Mirror Pond.

images.title: K  A / Lake in the Park
images.caption: Lake in the Park. This tranquil spot is located in the superb landscaped parkland.

images.title: Stuart Shepherd / Belton House, South Facade
images.caption: Cricket in the park in front of the South Facade in the summer of 2009.

description: Explore the stunning grounds of this 17th century mansion in Lincolnshire on this easy circular walk. The property is owned by the National Trust and boasts an Orangery, an Italian garden with fountains, a maze, a deer park and several delightful lakes and ponds. The house has been described as the most complete example of a typical English country house belonging to the Brownlow and Cust family for 300 years. Belton house is located just to the north of the town of Grantham . You can extend your walking in the area by picking up the Grantham Canal and enjoying an easy waterside stroll through the county.
